title: Emails Disappeared
content:
Hello,

I have recently noticed that all my email in Thunderbird between August 26, 2024 and early November has gone missing. I have not changed anything in my Account Settings.

Coinciding with this, Thunderbird has lost all my emails in the Sent and Drafts folders (except for recent ones from December). Oddly enough both folders show data is in them, even though no emails appear. The Sent folder has 119 mb and the Drafts folder has 62 mb shown.

In the account settings for "Copies & Folder," I have "Place a copy in Sent folder" checked. The same goes for the Drafts checkbox. I do not see anything out of the ordinary. I have also run a repair on the folders, but that did not help.

So: How can I recover my emails from August to early November? How can I prevent the emails in my Sent and Draft folders from disappearing?
creator: Carol76

title: Help an old man migrate from Eudora after 20 years
content:
I've been (mostly happily until 2 yrs ago) with Eudora. My usage model is to keep all (saved) email locally (20 yrs archive), access via POP. Unfortunately, the evolution of HTML, iso character sets, etc has been forcing me to move on. I tried TB about 2 yrs ago and abandoned the project for lack of time and urgency. I'm trying again, but now very serious. Anyway, I set up an install and did basic tests - all ok. But I can't seem to find config options to customize. I found some option to set my mail store to a folder of my choice (away from the system root -- C:\ - i use windows 10-11.) to something like E:\docs\tb. It created inbox, trash etc. right there. My previous install attempt (2 yrs ago) created these in a subfolder named for the email account (eudora calls 'personalities'). I do want to use multiple accounts each in their own 'garden', not in the same inbox, outbox, etc.. I can't find where to configure this - I can't even find how to configure my earlier choice to store them on E:. What am I missing? On some settings for copies and folders, it offers (eg) Sent folder on <email account>. I presume this is particular to IMAP and not relevant to my current setup.

That's enough to get me started, but I would like to eventually migrate my Eudora archives to TB, so a pointer to docs on this would be appreciated.

Tnx, Tom
creator: tdaly

title: il programma cancella automaticamente la mail pec
content:
Buongiorno utilizziamo Mozilla Thunderbird per la mia pec personale legalmail Il problema è che quando ricevo una pec , il programma Mozilla Thunderbird elimina automaticamente la mail inserendola nel cestino Se provo a spostarla nella casella posta in arrivo ma inserisce subito nel cestino L'account è configurato come IMAP. Accediamo anche dall'applicazione di Legalmail dal browser e li le email non si eliminano. Non abbiamo impostato nessun filtro e nessun estensione.

Cosa devo fare? Grazie
creator: studiofivizzani

title: email bloccata amministrazione@minuteriecassano.it
content:
Buongiorno,

da stamattina la mail della società Minuterie Cassano S.r.l. (amministrazione@minuteriecassano.it) non funziona Mi appare infatti il seguente errore: Non è stato possibile inviare il messaggio perché la connessione al server in uscita (SMTP) non è riuscita. Il server potrebbe non essere disponibile o rifiutare le connessioni in uscita (SMTP). Verificare che le impostazioni del server in uscita (SMTP) siano corrette e riprovare.

Vi chiedo cortese e celere riscontro.

Grazie

Distinti saluti Elisa Colombo
creator: colomboelisa92

title: CalDAV calendar cannot be enabled
content:
I have a calendar with a CalDAV connection through my hosting service. The CalDAV connection is fine, because it is working properly on my phone. However, when I try and add the calendar in Thunderbird I run into problems.

I have managed to create the calendar and Thunderbird did accept my login credentials. The calendar appears in the calendar menu, but it is not enabled. When I try and enable it, it immediately jumps back to "not enabled". What could be causing this, and how do I get around it?

Thank you sincerely, Rasmus

title: Problem with the migration of a profile to a new PC
content:
Hello,

We are having a problem with migrating a profile to a new PC. We saved the profile on the old PC and then loaded it onto the new PC. When we open Thunderbird with the profile transferred to the new PC, all the mailboxes are displayed correctly and everything works as expected. Then when we close Thunderbird and reopen it, we see the mailboxes but in which no data is present. We have tried the procedure again by multiple means but we always end up with the same result.

However, this is a procedure that I have carried out many times within my company and I have never encountered this problem.

Do you have any suggestions please?

Thank you, Sincerely,
creator: jeremie.saen

title: CSV Adress book fields
content:
Hello there :)

I just merged all my CSV files from all my different emails into one big file. I managed to import it in TB, playing with the checkbox for the matching fields so far so good

but

some of my contact have 3 emails, and i need those. so i added a custom field in TB, for the 3rd email (cause the default in TB is 2 emails)

then, if i edit a contact, add a 3rd email to it, it all display ok in TB

the issue i have now, is if i export my adress book back to CSV, that 3rd email information is lost during the process. the "custom" field in the csv field is blank, and the "3rd email" i created in TB is nowhere to be found

anyone could tell me if it's a TB limitation, or if i'm doing something wrong? :)

many thanks,

Baptiste

title: Thunderbird mail junk controls
content: Thunderbird Mails junk controls are themselves junk - they do not work. Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges and you have enough disk space to copy the mailbox.

title: Email disappearing as soon as it downloads
content: I have pop accounts set up for my business. Ever since the last Thunderbird upgrade, I've been seeing messages download and then immediately disappear. Some of these have been critical things that I needed to get, and I've had to ask the sender to repeatedly re-send them before they stopped disappearing as soon as they came in. They have been from a wide variety of sources, including the US government, so it's not a problem with the sender. I've used Thunderbird for all the years that it's been available, without any problems ever, until this began. Please fix it, whatever it is!
creator: admin922
